p: Proliferation and survival of B cells is mediated by the B cellâ€“activating factor (BAFF). In the study conducted by Le Pottier et al. [ 104], authors found that IVIg contained NAbs for BAFF. This could explain the reduction in proliferation, as well as the increased rates of apoptosis of B cells. Regarding the latter process, it was found that anti-Fas (anti-CD95) antibodies, present in IVIg preparations, induced apoptosis in B cells [ 105].
